thread.title: Goal-line technology helps Lorient to 1-1 draw with Rennes in French league
thread.title_full: Goal-line technology helps Lorient to 1-1 draw with Rennes in French league

title: Goal-line technology helps Lorient to 1-1 draw with Rennes in French league
text:
Goal-line technology helps Lorient to 1-1 draw with Rennes in French league THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   1:53   1:53   
People: 
France (192) 
PARIS â€” Kamil Grosicki equalized with the help of goal-line technology as Rennes held 10-man Lorient to a 1-1 draw in the French league on Saturday. 
The Poland international came off the bench to cancel out Raphael Guerreiro's opener in the Britany derby with a direct free kick that keeper Benjamin Lecomte stopped with a two-hand save in the 68th minute, but replays confirmed the ball had crossed the line. 
It was the first time that a French league goal was validated by the technology introduced this season in France. 
Rennes's equalizer came just two minutes after Lamine Kone was sent off for a second yellow card after he held Giovanni Sio. The Rennes forward was expelled too, in the 84th minute for a dangerous tackle. 
Seventh-place Rennes remains one point ahead of Lorient and nine points behind leader Paris Saint-Germain, which hosts Saint-Etienne on Sunday. 
Portuguese left back Guerreiro put the hosts in front in the 24th minute from Stevem Moreira's assist with his first goal this season. 
Lorient had two more good chances to extend its lead through captain Yann Jouffre and Vincent Le Goff before Sio was fouled by Kone as he raced toward the goal. 
The momentum switched to Rennes and Grosicki put the teams level. He came close of adding a second goal with a chip just wide in the 89th minute.
